content: TPK community corner hey guys welcome back to another episode of black magic
crap I just want to reflect a little bit about stuff going on in the community
that I think you should know about there are some fairly unknown people and
channels that I want to recommend to you but there's also some very big channels
far bigger and more established in the community than I am that if I tell you
about happy are going to go well yeah obviously I know about that but the
thing is I've noticed that as my channels are growing I am quickly
becoming a lot of people's first introduction into terrain building or
even D&D terrain organ TV in general so it's put me in an interesting position
where now I am people's first introduction and not the people that
introduced me so I think it is important that I introduce all of those people to
the real colors of this community the people that made me want to get started
so the number one person I you cannot talk about community and channels
without talking about DM Scotty Scotty is the Godfather of this hobby and this
community online and anybody who would argue that is insane
dear Scotty has been making tutorial videos of how to make cheap easy terrain
and crafter DD game for four or five years now he's got hundreds of videos
and he has done amazing work and more importantly he started the DM Scotty's
crafts and games Facebook group that is by far the best online community for
this hobby if you are not a member of that Facebook group as soon as you're
done watching this video Pech like right now in another window go join that group
it is the best place for you online especially if you're new to the Hobby
there's like I don't know 10,000 people on there
and everybody is super friendly and helpful it's amazing because in the same
day you will see people posting pictures of elaborate hyper detailed intimidating
builds right next to a simple thing that somebody made other some cardboard and
hot glue and the wonderful thing is that both those types of projects get equal
amount of attention respect and enjoyment from the community if you ever
have a question that you feel stupid asking that's the place that you can do
it without feeling stupid because everybody there is keen to to help
people and share their knowledge and honestly there isn't no attitude there
whatsoever and I don't think I've ever found a place online that was that warm
and inviting and just wonderful of a community if you're unfamiliar with TM
Scotty his channel is called DMS craft and his group is DM Scotty's crafts and
games on Facebook and you owe it to yourself to check out his videos and
join his community links are in the description now DM Scotty was my
introduction to the Hobby when I went on YouTube looking for some information but
I very very very quickly also came across a channel that is my personal
favorite and is run by one of my favorite people in the community and
somebody I'm happy to call a friend now that man is hankering for an ale his
channels drunk ins and Dragons if you don't know drunkenness and Dragons you
need to change that you need to call in sick from work and spend a day going
through his catalogue of videos because he has imparted more knowledge for the
crafting DM just damming in general than anyone I know he is a treasure trove
wealth of know what I think he's part alien I don't think he's of this world
he's just amazing that's all I can really say now his channel is not a
dedicated crafting channel by no means most of his stuff is more philosophical
it's about how to be a DM I had to run a better D&D game but
while using terrain so it you can take all the crap that I show you how to
build and he will teach you how to use it effectively how to run awesome
encounters how to design a room just how to be a badass DM hankered burn mail and
there's a funny thing most of you have seen his channel and you've heard his
name a million times it took me like a year to realize what hankering for an
ale with that name I didn't realize that it was a pun on hankering for an ale
how did I go a year not realizing what his silly name meant anyways check out
his channel I'm going to talk about his channel more in a future TPK because he
is about to drop a bomb on the RPG community with his own design rule
system and that I play it's going to be awesome but we're going to talk about
that more in another episode now that I've talked about two of the Titans of
the community I wanted to take a chance to talk about a couple channels that are
just starting out and I would like to recommend to you and I think they could
use some more subscribers and some more attention the first of those channels is
called starships and steel and it's run by a friend of mine one of my patreon
supporters named Keith and he talks a lot about different crafting stuff
sometimes he does some tutorials he focuses a lot on the Conan RPG which I
don't play but if you do then you definitely want to check out his channel
overall he is just an enjoyable cool guy that I would love to share a beer with
so I enjoy watching him talk about whatever it is he feels like talking
about that episode and one of the things he does like talking about is beer which
after DMD and terrain building is probably my third favorite hobby I
really like craft beer so he does little reviews with his video so if you are
into that sort of thing you also may enjoy that and
another smaller channel that I think you guys might enjoy is called kwazii's
belltower and this is a channel that is run by a guy named Andrew he's a you
know a big part of the online community he makes some cool stuff and he does a
lot of tutorials and I myself have learned some stuff from his videos and
he actually just recently did a video making like a gothic style fence that
used these really nice looking plastic skewers that he got off Amazon and they
look really cool and he bought like 10,000 of them so after he was done with
making his stuff he sent some out to a few of us other channels and I got a
package from him with these which I'm really thankful for and I will be using
them in a future build myself so of course the links to both of these guys
channels will be in the description below
and I will also put a link to the skewers I talked about because they are
something you should pick up there's a lot of things you could build with them
and I think in future black hunter craft episodes I'll probably be using them and
unrelated to terrain building another channel that I really enjoy is a channel
called taking 20 by my friend Cody I actually had the honour of being a guest
on his show not too long ago where we just had a discussion about terrain
encounters you know crafting a set of just different stuff he comes from a
roll20 theater of the mind online kind of background and I obviously come from
the tabletop with 3d terrain background and we kind of discussed the places
where those game those types of games crossover and where they're different
and the dangers of each of them you should probably check out that video
I'll put a link to that video specifically in the description but from
there you can jump around and check out all the other stuff he's done he he's
got a lot of cool videos about how to improve your game different things he
also did a 30 day D&D the video challenge where he answered a
whole bunch of questions over the period of the month which is a big undertaking
for him and something that I probably would not put in the effort to do and
the last thing I want to talk about in this community sort of segment is both
of the frozen king there is a publishing company called
absolute tabletop really it's for awesome dudes from the community who
loved Hindi and RPGs and for years have been in no small way improving that
community one of the ways they've been doing that is by releasing supplements
and adventures and they are really good they are by far my favorite independent
publisher some of the best games I've run were the sewers under sand wall game
that I did based on their module link in the description they are just really
cool guys they each have their own channels which I might talk about in
future video separately but the important thing is that they are about
to launch a big supplement called both of the frozen King it's a unique sort of
thing because it's not an adventure it's not it's an adventure kit you know it
has tools in it to craft your own adventure and encounter and you can
reskin it you can use it many times so it's kind of thing that you don't buy it
and run it once you can use it in your toolbox over and over again they
currently have a Kickstarter running for it to fund it and it is hot it is very
successful so I don't even need my kind of encouragement for my viewers to go
check it out but I think you guys should check it out if you are interested in
high quality independent Publishing's the Kickstarter is going on more by the
time this video airs it might be coming close to an end so click on the link
sooner than later if you're interested in buying a hard copy I can say
that this little adventure kit is going to be very enjoyable for your game table
and I can say that honestly because I just recently actually played in a play
test game of it that was hosted by mate from WASD 20 another person you should
check out and it was a really fun one-shot adventure I had a really good
time playing it I've also watched some other play test videos of people playing
it and the amazing thing is we both played in the same adventure they were
totally different games not like there was some crossover but it's like I could
have played in the other games and had no spoilers known or at least not many
because the way this adventure kid is set up it lends itself to repeated use
that is my last referral for this episode and if you are watching this on
the Friday that it was released that means this is your last chance to enter
the contest I'm running for this free procs on Hotwire table put a link in the
description for that contest go fast last chance I am going to announce the
winners tomorrow on that I should bid you guys farewell of course if you like
this video hit that like button drop me a comment below hit subscribe check out
black magic crafts on Facebook check out my website black magic crafty a there I
have an Amazon affiliate store where you can buy all the gear you need to build
cool [ __ ] and a small part of all those sales helped to fund this channel if you
really really want to help me and this channel out and you want to say thanks
for the work that I'm doing the best way you can do that is by supporting black
magic crafts on patreon the funds from my patreon supporters are the reason
that I can continue to invest time into this channel and buy equipment to make
it a reality I got lots of cool rewards for the people who helped me out so
please check it out alright guys until next time Cheers
